meanings.sent1: The temblor of the train made the passengers uneasy.
meanings.sent2: I felt a slight temblor in my hands as I held the delicate vase.
meanings.sent3: The temblor of excitement in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a temblor of fear as she spoke about the dark forest.
meanings.sent5: The temblor of the thunderstorm rattled the windows.

meanings.sent1: The temblor shook the entire city, causing buildings to sway.
meanings.sent2: People rushed out of their homes during the temblor to seek safety.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected temblor interrupted the picnic, sending food flying.
meanings.sent4: The temblor of emotions within her mirrored the earthquake outside.
meanings.sent5: The temblor left a trail of destruction in its wake.
